item.title: Portugal Golden Visa 2025: The Truth About the Fund Route (Not Real Estate)
item.description: Real estate is no longer the main path for Portugal’s Golden Visa. Learn the truth about the 2025 fund route — how CMVM-regulated investment funds work, the €500K minimum, residency timeline, and why this strategy now leads the way for international investors.
item.content:encoded:
Since the 2023 legal reforms, direct real estate investment no longer qualifies for Portugal’s Golden Visa. This major shift has positioned regulated investment funds as the primary and most strategic pathway for international investors seeking EU residency. If you’re considering the program in 2025, understanding the truth about the fund route is essential.

Unlike the old real estate option, which involved purchasing property, the fund route requires a minimum investment of €500,000 into a qualifying Portuguese investment fund. These funds are regulated by the Portuguese Securities Market Commission (CMVM), ensuring transparency, security, and compliance with EU standards.

How the Fund Route Works

The process is straightforward: applicants subscribe to shares in a CMVM-regulated fund designed for capital appreciation or venture capital. These funds invest in a diversified portfolio of Portuguese companies, driving economic growth in sectors like technology, hospitality, and renewable energy. The investment must be maintained for at least five years, aligning with the minimum residency requirement before applying for citizenship.

Key Benefits of the Fund Route:

  1. Compliance and Simplicity: The fund route eliminates the complexities of property acquisition, management, and taxes. The entire process is managed by a professional fund manager.
  2. Diversification: Instead of tying capital to a single property, your investment is spread across multiple assets, reducing risk.
  3. Professional Management: Your capital is managed by experts with a deep understanding of the Portuguese market, aiming for long-term growth.
  4. Clear Path to Residency: The fund investment is a clear, government-approved pathway, simplifying the AIMA (Agency for Integration, Migrations, and Asylum) application process.

For investors seeking a secure, professionally managed, and compliant route to EU residency in 2025, the fund-based Portugal Golden Visa is the definitive modern strategy. It offers not only a path to a second passport but also a sound financial investment in one of Europe's most dynamic economies.

item.title: The Portugal Golden Visa: Your Complete 2025 Guide to EU Residency
item.description: Comprehensive 2025 guide: eligibility, current fund options, AIMA process, and timeline to citizenship.
item.content:encoded:
The Portugal Golden Visa remains one of the world's most sought-after residency-by-investment programs in 2025, offering a clear path to EU citizenship. After significant changes in 2023, the program now focuses on non-real estate investments, with the investment fund option emerging as the most popular route. This guide covers everything you need to know to navigate the process successfully.

Eligibility Requirements

To qualify, applicants must be non-EU/EEA/Swiss citizens, make a qualifying investment, and maintain a clean criminal record. The minimum stay requirement is just seven days per year on average, making it ideal for investors who do not wish to relocate immediately.

The Investment Fund Route

The primary route in 2025 is a minimum investment of €500,000 into a qualifying Portuguese investment fund. These funds must be regulated by the Portuguese Securities Market Commission (CMVM). This option offers professional management, diversification, and a hands-off approach compared to previous real estate investments.

The AIMA Application Process

  1. Choose Your Investment: Select a CMVM-regulated fund and complete the subscription process.
  2. Gather Documentation: Prepare all necessary personal documents, including your passport, proof of investment, and criminal record certificates.
  3. Submit Application: Your legal representative will submit the application online via the AIMA portal.
  4. Biometrics Appointment: Attend a scheduled appointment in Portugal for biometrics collection.
  5. Receive Residency Card: Once approved, you and your family will receive your residency cards, valid for two years.

Timeline to Citizenship

After holding the Golden Visa residency for five years and demonstrating basic knowledge of the Portuguese language (A2 level), you can apply for permanent residency and Portuguese citizenship. This grants you the right to live, work, and study anywhere in the European Union.

Step 1: Choose Your Legal Partner

Your first and most critical step is to hire a reputable Portuguese law firm specializing in Golden Visa applications. They will guide you through the entire process, ensure compliance, and handle all communications with the authorities.

Step 2: Obtain a Portuguese Tax Number (NIF) and Open a Bank Account

Your lawyer will assist you in obtaining a NIF (Número de Identificação Fiscal) and opening a Portuguese bank account. These are mandatory for making the investment.

Step 3: Select and Make Your Investment

The primary route is a €500,000 investment into a qualifying investment fund. Conduct due diligence and choose a fund regulated by the Portuguese Securities Market Commission (CMVM). Step 4: Prepare and Submit Your Application

Your lawyer will help you gather all required personal documents, including your passport, criminal record certificates, and the proof of investment. The application is then submitted online through the official portal of AIMA (Agency for Integration, Migrations, and Asylum).

Step 5: Attend Your Biometrics Appointment

After the initial online approval, you and your family members will need to attend a scheduled biometrics appointment in Portugal to provide fingerprints and photographs and to show your original documents.

Step 6: Receive Your Residency Card

Once AIMA gives the final approval, your residency cards will be issued. These are typically valid for two years and can be renewed as long as you maintain your investment and meet the minimum stay requirements.
